info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 09 at 10:31AM AST until September 11 at 8:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM AST MONDAY... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves of 6 and 10 feet, and occasionally higher. * WHERE...Beaches along St Croix Eastern Half. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, from 6 AM AST this morning through Monday evening. For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 PM this evening through 8 PM AST Monday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents that can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water where it becomes difficult to return to safety. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...It is very likely that the High Rip Current Risk statements and High Surf Advisories might be extended through most of next week as Hurricane Lee continues moving northward over the western Atlantic.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions.
